issue: Reason adds interpretive content not explicit in source. Source says the sin was Zimri's free choice so the mitzvah of Pinchas was also by free choice, hence schar is due by din. Index reason adds 'ממילא גם המצוה שנגרמה על ידה אינה מן השמים אלא זכות עצמית' which is a reasonable paraphrase but adds 'ולא בתורת חסד' not in source.
Reason adds 'מידה כנגד מידה' concept not explicitly stated in source. Source simply says Hashem will send blessing in their handiwork. The midah-kneged-midah framing is an interpretive addition.

Reason adds 'אין כאן דין שליחות ואין לומר שלוחו של אדם כמותו' which is not in the source text. Source discusses la talin and the idea that no one else could do the mitzvah, but the shlichus framing is added by the index.

Reason adds 'מצוה שרבים נכשלים בה ומעטים עומדים בה מעידה על מסירות יתירה ועמידה בניסיון מיוחד' which is interpretive elaboration. Source simply states the fact that schar in olam hazeh is given for a unique mitzvah that most fail at, without explaining why this is the mechanism.

Summary says 'יש בהן שכר מצוה בעולם הזה לנשים' — the source discusses mitzvos aseh shehazman grama generally regarding women being exempt, but does not say women specifically receive schar in olam hazeh. The phrasing 'לנשים' in the summary is misleading — the source says these mitzvos have schar in olam hazeh generally.

Reason adds 'מידה כנגד מידה' concept not present in source. Source only says the one who is zahir in mezuzah and checks it regularly merits a nice dwelling. The midah-kneged-midah reasoning is fabricated.

Reason adds 'מדה כנגד מדה: המחבב את המזוזה שבפתח ביתו ומנשקה' — source text only states the fact that one who kisses the mezuzah merits a nice dwelling. The midah-kneged-midah reasoning is not in the source.
Reason adds 'מידה כנגד מידה' and 'שהמזוזה שומרת הבית והמהדר בה זוכה לבית נאה' — source only states the fact of meriting a nice dwelling. The mechanism is fabricated.

Reason adds 'חומרת העונש מלמדת על גודל המצוה' which is an interpretive addition. Source simply states that since there is kares for bitul milah, schar in olam hazeh applies. The index adds a causal explanation not present in the source.

Reason adds 'מצות מילה על כל חלקיה ועניניה נחשבת ממצוות שאדם אוכל פירותיהן בעולם הזה' — source says those involved in milah merit achilas peiros in olam hazeh but does not explicitly categorize milah as one of the mitzvos in the mishna of 'eilu devarim she'adam ochel'. The generalization is slightly beyond the source.
Reason adds 'מידה כנגד מידה' concept not in source. Source says shmirat habrit leads to kol tuvot ha'olam hazeh, referencing the pasuk. Index adds the midah-kneged-midah framing as reasoning.

Reason adds 'מידה כנגד מידה — המשלח את האם ונוטל את הבנים, מרחם על האם, זוכה שהקב"ה ירחם עליו ויזכהו לבנים' — source only states 'שילוח הקן שכרו שיהיו לו בנים'. The midah-kneged-midah reasoning about rachamim is entirely fabricated and not in the source.
Reason adds 'הקרבנות מעוררים שפע ברכה מלמעלה לצרכי העולם הזה' which is interpretive elaboration. Source simply states that in merit of korbanos Hashem gives mazonos.

Reason adds 'כיון שנשמר מנדנוד איסור עריות והתגבר על יצרו בדבר חמור זה, זכותו גדולה עד שמשלמין לו שכרו גם בעולם הזה' — source simply says he was shomer from nidnud issur arayos and therefore merited schar in olam hazeh. The index fabricates a reasoning about 'zchuso gedolah' and 'hisgaber al yitzro' not present in the source.

Reason says 'תורה שבעל פה שונה משאר מצוות...בתורה שבעל פה יש חריגה מכלל זה' — this is vague and adds no real reasoning. Source also does not provide a reason (taam) — it simply states the fact. The index should either note there is no explicit reason or leave the reason minimal. Instead it adds interpretive filler.

Reason focuses on 'מסירות נפש שבלימוד התורה' which comes only from one of three sources cited (ואך פרי תבואה). The index synthesizes this as THE reason while the source has multiple distinct approaches. The baal haturim source says Torah brings blessings, Peah says talmud torah kneged kulam. Only the third source mentions 'memis atzmo aleha'.

Reason adds 'הרי זה כפועל שעשה מלאכתו ודינו כלבושו וכליו של הקב״ה' — source text is partially garbled/unclear ('דינא כלבשו כסימניס של בשר״ו') but the index interprets it as 'like a worker who did his work'. The interpretation may be reasonable but adds specificity to unclear source text.

Reason adds 'מי שמכוון להלכה בלימודו מעלתו גדולה עד שאינו נמוט' — source says 'lo yimot ol' (will not be shaken forever) and therefore schar in olam hazeh. The index elaborates with 'maalato gedolah' which is not in the source.

Reason adds 'השמחה מוסיפה שלמות לקיום המצוה ועל כן ראוי לשכר מיידי' — source simply states that one who is happy in his toil in Torah, Hashem establishes full schar in olam hazeh. The 'mosifa shleimus' reasoning is fabricated.

Reason adds 'מה שאין כן בלימוד שלא לשמה שאין בו מעלה זו' — source says schar in olam hazeh for Torah applies only to lishmah learning, but the index adds a contrasting explanation about shelo lishmah that is not in the source text.
